job_description:
About The Role And About You

Zwift is looking for a Senior Software Development Engineer in the Growth team. The Growth team owns software and services that customers interact with concerning their Zwift subscription. You will have a chance to go deep in a variety of different domains - performance and channel marketing and measurement, payments, customer communications, and finance (tax and accounting) in a recurring charge business - to deliver lasting, high-impact solutions for Zwift and its customers. If you have a knack for rooting out complexity, delivering simple yet elegant technical solutions that also scale, in partnership with other engineers, we should chat. We’re looking for leaders just like you.

We place a high value on flexibility, transparency, and fun while supporting our team to do their best work.

What You’ll Do

Lead and contribute to solution design and implementation for features in the Growth space. You’ll be expected to work with your team to influence the technical direction.
Design, build, and support business and customer goals in the connectivity area. You’ll work full-stack across codebases including our subscriptions and payments back-end (Java), and our customer facing front-ends (Node, NextJS, React, Angular). Success here is indicated by delivering systems that meet functional needs with high quality metrics and automated testing.
Proactively advise your team and manager concerning the state of the software and projects. You’ll push your team to take action and solve challenging problems.
Drive software engineering best practices within the team including continual process improvement. You’ll embrace experimentation and iteration and mentor others along the same lines. You’ll be joining an existing team and will help level up our structure and vision.
Support the growth and career development of your team through interviewing, mentoring, and contributing to the growth of more junior engineers.
Debug and resolve challenging connectivity issues along with your team and peer teams. Where possible you’ll evaluate systemic root causes, seeking the help of staff engineers where necessary.

What We’re Looking For

5+ years of experience in full-stack development
2+ years experience in a work/team environment with object-oriented languages (like C++, Java, Scala) and web frameworks (like React, Angular)
Experienced in structured, methodical problem solving and debugging.
Track record of effective collaboration with engineering peers across teams. Strikes the right balance between accepting workable solutions and pushing for better alternatives
Demonstrated ability to make technical trade-offs considering both long-term and short-term impact.
Holding self and team accountable for outcome, Credits others for their contributions and accomplishments and creates an environment in which differences are openly shared, celebrated, and incorporated into the team’s activities.

Bonus Points

Passionate about the fitness, wellness, or gaming space
Experienced working with geographically distributed teams.
While this is a flexible/in office as needed position, we’re looking for candidates who are within the greater Toronto area to facilitate semi-regular in-person connections with other “Watopians” (a.k.a., Zwift employees).

How To Stand Out Among The Rest

Your resume/CV is enough to show off your skills, accomplishments, and experience. However, if you choose to include a cover letter introducing us to your awesome personality, we will read that too.

We strongly believe that different backgrounds and ideas are a competitive advantage; we hire candidates of any race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital or family status, disability, Veteran status, and any other status. Zwift is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by emailing careers@zwift.com.

Zwift, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Transparency In Coverage

Health plan price transparency is designed to help consumers know the cost of covered items or healthcare-related services prior to the date upon which they receive care. Transparency in Coverage (TIC) regulations require health insurers and group health plans to create machine readable files (MRFs) that contain the negotiated rates for in-network providers and allowed amounts derived from historical claims for out-of-network providers and make those files publicly available.
